Class Command

java.lang.Object
Command
public class Command
extends java.lang.Object
This class is part of the RPandaScape application. RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game. This class holds information about a command that was issued by the user. A command currently consists of three strings: a command word, a second word and a third one (for example, if the command was "take apple 3", then the 3 strings obviously are "take", "map" and 3). The way this is used is: Commands are already checked for being valid command words. If the user entered an invalid command (a word that is not known) then the command word is null. If the command had only one word, then the second and third word are null.
Version:
2021.10.27 + 2021.12.12
Author:
Elie DUBOUX

  • Constructor Details

    • Command

      public Command​(java.lang.String pCommandWord, java.lang.String pSecondWord, java.lang.String pThirdWord)
      Create a command object. First, second and third word must be supplied, they can be null.
      Parameters:
      pCommandWord - The first word of the command. Null if the command was not recognised.
      pSecondWord - The second word of the command.
      pThirdWord - The third word in a command.

  • Method Details

    • getCommandWord

      public java.lang.String getCommandWord()
      Return the command word (the first word) of this command. If the command was not understood, the result is null.
      Returns:
      The command word.

    • getSecondWord

      public java.lang.String getSecondWord()
      Return the second word of this command. If the command was not understood, the result is null.
      Returns:
      The second word.

    • getThirdWord

      public java.lang.String getThirdWord()
      Return the third word of this command. If the command was not understood, the result is null.
      Returns:
      The third word.

    • hasSecondWord

      public boolean hasSecondWord()
      Check if the command has a second word.
      Returns:
      True if the command has a second word, false if it does not.

    • hasThirdWord

      public boolean hasThirdWord()
      Check if the command has a third word.
      Returns:
      True if the command has a third word, false if it does not.

    • getThirdWordNumber

      public int getThirdWordNumber()
      Get and transform the third word if it is a number.
      Returns:
      The third word if it is a number, 1 if not.

    • isUnknown

      public boolean isUnknown()
      Check if the command exist in CommandWords
      Returns:
      True if the commandWord doesn't exist, false if it is.
